hierarchy.entry_domain: Threat Modeling in SDLC and DevSecOps

learning_objectives.objective: Define key terms: build-time security analysis, attestation, provenance, software supply chain, vulnerability, and risk.

Explain the role of build-time security analysis in the SDLC, DevSecOps, and supply chain security, including its alignment with shift-left principles and prior knowledge of threat modeling (e.g., STRIDE or DREAD).
Demonstrate how to integrate security checks (e.g., SAST, SCA using tools like Snyk or GitHub Dependabot) into a CI/CD pipeline.
Compare build-time security analysis versus runtime analysis, identifying trade-offs in detection timing, false positives, and supply chain risk mitigation.
Critique the effectiveness of NIST SSDF (SP 800-218) and NIST SP 800-161 Rev. 1 practices in mitigating real-world supply chain attacks like SolarWinds or Log4j.
Design a build-time security analysis workflow for a sample project, incorporating SBOM generation, SLSA levels, and security gates in a CI/CD pipeline.
